1.name: Posting invocation Point
1.description: Posting is performed before completion of incoming message or sending out of outgoing/onward message.  Posting type selection rule is evaluated. Rule action is the required posting type (e.g. MAIN_DR,MAIN_CR, FEE_DR, PNL_CR etc.).

2.name: Posting invocation Point
2.description: 2-step accounting will be performed: Once the transaction stopped in the queue, 1st accounting leg is performed: • Debit the customer  • Credit a suspence account. After the transaction is released from the queue and continues processing, the 2nd accounting leg is performed (at the standard invocation point):  • Debit the suspence account  • Credit the Nostro/Vostro

4.name: Posting invocation Point
4.description: Specifically for 2-step accounting: as there is 2-step accounting, XXBank need also balance invocation before the Posting. BI functionality of return codes will be part of to the Posting Interface. Usually (happy flow) BI is done and at the posting step there is no need to invoke it again. Need a marker field to indicate at posting that  BI was already done or not (try using existing monitors). The same BI behavior is required in Posting.

6.name: Inteface Selection
6.description: the relevant posting interface is selected

8.name: Posting Type Selection
8.description: Create Posting Type entries for: - MAIN_DR - Principle debit amount  - MAIN_CR - Principle credit amount  - FEE_DR –  fees on debit side customer - PNL_DR - Amount in P&L account for fees on debit side * Fee related entry is generated only if fee applied to the payment.

9.name: Posting Type Selection
9.description: Create Posting Type entries for: - MAIN_DR - Principle debit amount  - MAIN_CR - Principle credit amount

10.name: Posting Type Selection
10.description: Create Posting Type entries for: - MAIN_DR - Principle debit amount  - MAIN_CR - Principle credit amount (including Agent fees) - AGT_FEE_DR -Agent fees on debit side customer  – for Outgoing messages

11.name: Posting Type Selection
11.description: Create Posting Type entries for: - MAIN_DR - Principle debit amount  - MAIN_CR - Principle credit amount (fees deducted) - PNL_CR - Amount in P&L account for fees on credit side customer

12.name: Posting Type Selection
12.description: Create Posting Type entries for: - MAIN_DR - Principle debit amount  - MAIN_CR - Principle credit amount  - FEE_DR –  fees on debit side customer - PNL_DR - Amount in P&L account for fees on debit side * Fee related entry is generated only if fee applied to the payment.

13.name: Posting Type Selection
13.description: Create Posting Type entries for: - MAIN_DR - Principle debit amount (Including Receiver"s fees) - MAIN_CR - Principle credit amount  - AGT_PNL_DR - Amount in P&L account for agent fees on debit side (CT)

14.name: Posting Type Selection
14.description: Create Posting Type entries for: - MAIN_DR - Principle debit amount  - MAIN_CR - Principle credit amount  Send MT191

15.name: Posting Type Selection
15.description: Create Posting Type entries for: - MAIN_DR - Principle debit amount  - MAIN_CR - Principle credit amount (fees deducted) - PNL_CR - Amount in P&L account for fees on credit side customer. (The "lower' amount after deduction of the sender's fees will be on F32, and this will be the amount credited to the Cr account.)

16.name: Suspense Account
16.description: Booking will be against a specific suspense account as follows: 1st Step: - MAIN_DR - Principle debit amount - SA_MAIN_CR - Credit to suspense account of principal amount * fees are also posted if applied 2nd Step: SA_MAIN_DR - Debit to suspense account of principal amount for 2-step-accounting for non-final queues. - MAIN_CR - Principle credit amount

17.name: Accounting Systems Balancing
17.description: A booking on the balancing account  will be done. Posting entries as follows: - MAIN_DR - Principle debit amount  - MAIN_CR - Principle credit amount (fees on credit side deducted) - PNL_CR - SA_CRSS_BOOK_MAIN_DBT_SD - Credit Principal amount- Cross-booking-systems balancing on debit side system - SA_CRSS_BOOK_MAIN_CDT_SD - Debit Principal amount- Cross-booking-systems balancing on credit side system

18.name: Fee Posting
18.description: If no fees are retuned, GPP is required to create a Posting entry for the 0 amount.

19.name: Reverse Posting
19.description: Reversal posting entries are generated for all posting entries that were originally created.

20.name: Reverse Posting
20.description: Reversal posting entries are generated for the 1st Posting leg.

21.name: Rejected
21.description: GPP shall not perform any posting when an Incoming payment is REJECTED

22.name: Posting Request content
22.description: All Posting type entries will be sent out in one request.

23.name: Posting Request content
23.description: GPP is required to send Base rate and Spot rate as part of the Posting requests, same as for Outgoing payments flow.

24.name: Posting Request content
24.description: GPP must be able to process an Incoming payment with the code word /REC/RIX and forward the information to IL (Posting request).

25.name: Posting Request content
25.description: GPP is required to receive “Cost center” attribute as part of the Account Lookup response and send it as part of the posting request.

26.name: Posting Request / Response content
26.description: Request and Response layout should be the same as for Delivery 1.

27.name: Interface Wait Behavior
27.description: Message must wait for a response in order to proceed with the flow

28.name: Interface Inactive behavior
28.description: The interface is Inactive For FILE Source:  Request is not created (except 990), stop the flow, and put the message in status MP_STOP. When the interface is active again, create the request, send it and continue with the flow. Source <> FILE: Request is not created (except 990), stop the flow, and put the message in status Rejected.

29.name: Response Handling
29.description: For FILE Source:  Stop the flow, and put the message in status MP_STOP. When the interface is active again, create the request, send it and continue with the flow. Source <> FILE: Stop the flow and put the message in status Rejected.

31.name: Transaction Code
31.description: Transaction Code for the principle amount and for the fees is included in the request layout.

32.name: Transaction Code
32.description: For outgoing with Product code 10 - always need to map the Förmånsvalutering transaction code to the credit transaction codes. For Incoming with Product code X, when we receive a flag from the Account Lookup, also need to select Förmånsvalutering Credit Transaction Code.

33.name: Transaction Code
33.description: The outcome of the product part determination rule should be available for transaction code rule(s) evaluation.

34.name: Fee Posting
34.description: GPP is required to determine required fees and to perform standard GPP fee.

35.name: Fee Posting
35.description: GPP is required to determine fees, save it as part of GPP message information and perform posting. GPP will receive zero amount in the Fee Response and is required to create a posting entry for the zero amount.

36.name: MT900/910
36.description: GPP must perform posting on MT900/MT910 in XXcurrency from certain defined sender BIC´s.

37.name: MT900/910
37.description: According to Clearing code received in F72 (and selected BA), GPP should send out the value of Posting Reference in F20 or 21 : F72 includes PMN or PMD - send F21. All other code - send F20.

38.name: Posting tab
38.description: Incoming - Posting entries are on the Direct Outgoing - Posting entries are on the Cover  The user can navigate from the Direct to the Cover and vice versa.

39.name: General
39.description: GPP must be able to receive and perform posting of  incoming MT202 in foreign currencies.
